message.content: This question requires some knowledge about the angle and structure of a pyramid. When rain falls on the apex of a pyramid, it will flow down the sides of the pyramid and end up at the footing or base of the pyramid. Option (A) is incorrect because rain would not flow upwards onto your shoes. Option (B) is not true because rain would not stay on the sides of the pyramid. Option (D) is also incorrect because the rain would not stay on the top of the pyramid.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the structure of a pyramid and the way rainwater flows. When it rains at the apex (highest point) of a pyramid, the water will flow down the sides of the pyramid and collect at the footing (base) of the pyramid. This is due to gravity and the slope of the sides. Option (A) is incorrect because the rainwater will not end up on your shoes if you are standing at the top of the pyramid. Option (B) is incorrect because the rainwater will not stay on the sides of the pyramid. Option (D) is also incorrect because the rainwater will not stay at the top of the pyramid.

This question involves understanding the way rainwater flows down a pyramid structure. When rain falls at the apex of a pyramid, it will flow down the sides of the pyramid. Since the footing refers to the base or bottom of the pyramid, it is where the rain will eventually end up. Therefore, the correct answer is option (C). Option (A) is incorrect because the rain will not end up specifically on someone's shoes. Option (B) is incorrect because the rain does not stay on the side of the pyramid. Option (A) is incorrect because the water will not end up on your shoes. Option (B) is also incorrect because the water will not stay on the sides of the pyramid.
